decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Detailed drawings or samples of materials, as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of the work: (a)  External joinery details of conservatory (elevations and sections) at a scale of not less than 1:20, etc. Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with the drawings as approved.  REASON: To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building. | The glazing in the flank elevations of the square bay of the conservatory shall contain only obscure glass/acid - etched and shall be permanently fixed shut.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. | The conservatory hereby permitted shall be timber framed, single glazed, and white painted and so maintained.  REASON:  To protect the character and appearance of the building which is statutorily listed.
description: Erection of a single storey rear conservatory and the insertion of a pair of French doors with sidelights in the existing rear projection (Listed Building Consent)
